xxl.core.util.concurrency
Class AsynchronousChannel

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.concurrency.AsynchronousChannel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Channel
public class AsynchronousChannel
extends java.lang.Object
implements Channel

Implements a channel by using semaphores. If the channel does not contain an object, the caller thread of the take method is blocked. If the channel contains an object, the caller thread of the put method is blocked.

The concept of channels is well described in Doug Lea: "Concurrent Programming in Java", Second Edition, Sun Microsystems. Online: http://java.sun.com/Series/docs/books/cp/ Be aware of the trickiness of concurrent programming!

Constructor Detail

AsynchronousChannel

public AsynchronousChannel(Semaphore putPermit,
                           Semaphore takePermit)
Constructs an asynchronous channel using the semaphores specified. Usually, the user does not use this constructor but the parameterless constructor.

Parameters:
putPermit - Semaphore which has to be acquired before writing the Object.
takePermit - Semaphore which has to be acquired before reading the Object.

Method Detail

take

public java.lang.Object take()
Waits for an object that is sent from a different thread via the put method.

Specified by:
take in interface Channel
Returns:
object from the channel

attemptTake

public boolean attemptTake(java.lang.Object[] o)
Tries to read an object from the channel. If an object is not availlable, this method returns false. The object is returned inside the first element of the object array.

Specified by:
attemptTake in interface Channel
Parameters:
o - Object array. The first element is used for returning the desired object
Returns:
true - iff there was an object in the channel

put

public void put(java.lang.Object object)
Puts an object into the channel.

Specified by:

Parameters:
object - object that is put into the channel

isEmpty

Determines if an object is currently in the channel (no blocking!).

Specified by:

Returns:
